title: Chinese healer faces manslaughter charge after woman dies in 'slapping therapy'
text:

A Chinese healer is facing a manslaughter charge after an elderly woman died at a "slapping therapy" workshop.

A warrant has been issued for the arrest of Hong Chi Xiao, 56, following the death of 71-year-old Danielle Carr-Gomm.

Mrs Carr-Gomm, from Sussex, died at a paida lajin therapy course at Cleeve House hotel in Wiltshire, in October 2016.

The controversial treatment involves patients being slapped or slapping themselves vigorously.

Mrs Carr-Gomm's family said she had sought the therapy to cure herself of diabetes.

Following an investigation the Crown Prosecution Service has given Wiltshire Police permission to charge Mr Xiao with gross negligence manslaughter.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Henry Nicholls SWNS.com)

The warrant to arrest him was issued at Salisbury Magistrates' Court on October 4.

Mr Xaio's registered address is in California and Wiltshire Police said they will be working with the relevant agencies to ensure he will stand trial.

Two other people who arrested at the time of the incident have been released with no further action.

The hotel is not accused of any wrongdoing and after Mrs Carr-Gormm's death the manager at the time said staff were helping police with their investigation.
